ðŸŒŸ TxtNet-Browser | Java
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Browsing the web over SMS when no WiFi or mobile data is available.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Browse the web over SMS â€¢ No WiFi or mobile data required â€¢ Uses Brotli compression â€¢ Custom Base-114 encoding â€¢ Removes media content, JavaScript, and CSS
ðŸ“– Summary: TxtNet Browser is an Android app that enables web browsing via SMS, eliminating the need for WiFi or mobile data. It achieves this by compressing HTML responses using Brotli and encoding them with a custom Base-114 format. The app also includes TxtNet Server, allowing users to host their own SMS-based web browsing service.

ðŸŒŸ SpacetimeDB | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Building multiplayer applications with real-time data synchronization.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multiplayer database â€¢ Real-time data synchronization â€¢ Relational database â€¢ Smart contract integration â€¢ Game development support
ðŸ“– Summary: SpacetimeDB is a relational database designed for building multiplayer applications. It focuses on providing real-time data synchronization and supports features like smart contracts, making it suitable for game development and other collaborative applications. The core concept is to enable multiplayer experiences with minimal latency.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ ml-course | Jupyter Notebook
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing materials and resources for a Machine Learning course.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Lectures and seminar recordings â€¢ Slides â€¢ Homework assignments â€¢ Deadlines â€¢ Course materials
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository hosts materials for an open Machine Learning course, including lecture recordings, slides, and homework assignments. It covers a range of topics from introductory concepts like Naive Bayes and kNN to more advanced topics like Deep Learning and Gradient Boosting. The course provides a structured learning path with deadlines for assignments.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ godoxy | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Simplifying reverse proxy setup and management for Dockerized applications, including automatic SSL certificate management, access control, and traffic management features.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Reverse proxy â€¢ Docker integration â€¢ WebUI â€¢ Automatic SSL certificate management (Let's Encrypt) â€¢ ACL (IP/CIDR, Country, Timezone)
ðŸ“– Summary: GoDoxy is a lightweight and performant reverse proxy designed for easy integration with Docker. It offers features like automatic SSL certificate management with Let's Encrypt, connection-level access control, and an intuitive WebUI for configuration and monitoring. GoDoxy simplifies the process of exposing and securing microservices.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ tcping | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Monitor network latency and connection quality using TCP, especially in environments where ICMP is blocked.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ TCP ping instead of ICMP when ICMP is blocked â€¢ Colored, plain, JSON, CSV, and sqlite3 output formats â€¢ Network latency, packet loss, and connection quality monitoring â€¢ Source interface, timeout, and interval specification â€¢ IPv4 and IPv6 support
ðŸ“– Summary: TCPING is a cross-platform ping utility that uses TCP instead of ICMP, making it suitable for environments where ICMP is blocked. It offers various output formats like JSON and CSV, and allows users to monitor network latency, packet loss, and connection quality. It supports IPv4/IPv6, and provides real-time connection statistics.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ ezbookkeeping | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Personal bookkeeping and financial management.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Self-hosted â€¢ Lightweight â€¢ Docker support â€¢ Multi-database support (SQLite, MySQL, PostgreSQL) â€¢ Cross-platform (Windows, macOS, Linux)
ðŸ“– Summary: ezBookkeeping is a lightweight, self-hosted personal finance application designed for ease of use on both desktop and mobile devices. It offers features such as multi-database support, Docker deployment, two-factor authentication, and data import/export, making it a versatile solution for managing personal finances.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ nwinfo | C
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Obtaining system and hardware information on Windows systems.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Obtains detailed system and hardware information (SMBIOS, CPUID, S.M.A.R.T., PCI, EDID) â€¢ Supports exporting data in JSON, YAML, and LUA formats â€¢ Gathers information directly without relying on WMI â€¢ Compatible with Windows XP
ðŸ“– Summary: NWinfo is a Win32 program designed to retrieve comprehensive system and hardware details. It gathers information directly, bypassing WMI, and supports various export formats like JSON, YAML, and LUA. The tool is compatible with older Windows versions, including Windows XP.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ capacitor | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Building cross-platform native Progressive Web Apps using web technologies like JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Cross-platform development for iOS, Android, and Web â€¢ Single codebase for multiple platforms â€¢ Cross-platform API for accessing native SDKs â€¢ Native plugin support (Swift, Kotlin/Java) â€¢ Progressive Web App (PWA) support
ðŸ“– Summary: Capacitor enables developers to build cross-platform applications for iOS, Android, and the web from a single codebase. It provides a unified API for accessing native features and supports the creation of native plugins. Capacitor also offers first-class PWA support, allowing applications to be deployed to both app stores and the mobile web.
